meanings.definition: Refusing to acknowledge or accept responsibility for something.
meanings.sent1: The disclaiming statement made it clear that they were not responsible for the mistake.
meanings.sent2: She had a disclaiming attitude towards the situation, avoiding any blame.
meanings.sent3: His disclaiming behavior was like a shield against any accusations.
meanings.sent4: The disclaiming nature of the company's response left many questions unanswered.
meanings.sent5: The disclaiming tone in his voice revealed his reluctance to take ownership.

meanings.definition: Denying any connection or involvement with something.
meanings.sent1: The disclaiming individual insisted they had no part in the incident.
meanings.sent2: Her disclaiming remarks suggested she wanted to stay out of the conflict.
meanings.sent3: The cat's disclaiming look seemed to say, 'I didn't knock over the vase!'
meanings.sent4: The disclaiming stance of the suspect raised suspicions among the investigators.
meanings.sent5: His disclaiming behavior only added to the mystery surrounding the case.

meanings.definition: Renouncing or giving up a claim or right to something.
meanings.sent1: He was disclaiming his inheritance in favor of pursuing his passion.
meanings.sent2: The company was disclaiming any profits from the controversial project.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she was disclaiming her title as 'Queen of Procrastination.'
meanings.sent4: By disclaiming his role in the decision, he distanced himself from the consequences.
meanings.sent5: The politician was disclaiming any association with the scandal to protect his reputation.
